sentences: Massimo Urbani (8 May 1957 – 23 June 1993) was an Italian jazz alto saxophonist.
He played principally in the bebop style.
Urbani was born in Primavalle, Rome on 8 May 1957, the oldest of five brothers.
His first instrument, from 1968, was the clarinet, but he soon switched to the alto saxophone.
Urbani died of a heroin overdose on 23 June 1993.
The Penguin Guide to Jazz commented that "Urbani's senseless death robbed Europe of a player whose records are a flawed testament to a bopper of enormous guts and facility."
1980 Dedications to A.A. & J.C. – Max's Mood (Red)
In with Tullio De Piscopo, Mike Melillo, Massimo Moriconi)
1987 Duets Improvisations for Yardbird with Mike Melillo (Philology)
